results.content: For such a narrow topic, I was hoping for a bit more. I have doubts about the quality of the code. One large function is shown, with nested if else statements. What if I have 20 conditions and there are many more fields? Writing in this way would be difficult and hard to read. For this, JS and CSS layers are mixed, e.g. "el.style.borderColor =" red ", which I don't like either. If I'm wrong, I will read what the author thinks about it. Maybe I don't understand something and I could change higher course rating.

response.content: Please note the prerequisites to the course and also in the description it  mentions what to expect and what is covered.  The styling you mention is not having to do with JavaScript and can be adjusted its only to demonstrate the learning objective within the course of element style manipulation which is correctly done.
response.content_html: Please note the prerequisites to the course and also in the description it mentions what to expect and what is covered. The styling you mention is not having to do with JavaScript and can be adjusted its only to demonstrate the learning objective within the course of element style manipulation which is correctly done.

For this, JS and CSS layers are mixed, e.g. "el.style.borderColor =" red ", which I don't like either. If I'm wrong, I will read what the author thinks about it. results.content:
This course is not a complete how to validate a form for various input types, it is a basic form validation course but it walks you through the process fo validation.  as I said, still limited to validate certain input types.

In the last section, there should have been a "form has been submitted" text after the form has been submitted.

After all, you can learn a thing or two if you are new to JavaScript and DOM manipulation. It is kinda outdated but for learning javascript, it is ok.

response.content: Thanks, please note the course description.   If you need any additional help I can help you in the Q&A section.
response.content_html: Thanks, please note the course description. If you need any additional help I can help you in the Q&A section.

After all, you can learn a thing or two if you are new to JavaScript and DOM manipulation. It is kinda outdated but for learning javascript, it is ok.
